reviewText:
MiniGolf Mania plays and feels great. The controls are tight, the camera system works well, the powerups are pretty fun, but there are only 9 holes right now (launch day; 3/25/16). I mean, what is here, is great. I am excited to play some local co-op this weekend. There is no online multiplayer.

I played through the existing 9 holes twice in about half an hour, solo style. It is probably the best minigolf game I've played.

I am going to give this a thumb's up for being fun for a mere three bucks, BUT you need to be aware that while the developers may add more holes, it very well could never happen.
voteText: 17 of 21 people (81%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
We liked it.
All of the controls are solid, and everything acts as expected.  It was fun to play through as a family (local) and I suspect we will play through quite a few times more before we're bored of it.

The only real downside is that there are only 9 holes, but the 9 holes are all very nice and for 2.99 (half of a trip to Starbucks) I can't really complain.  Hopefully there will be more holes added in the future.  Even if they're 1.99 per 9 hole DLC, I'd buy it.

Good work.  Fun game.

reviewText:
So they're either the devs of Minigolf Adventures, or this is an homage to it.

Either way, devs? Please increase the price, so that you can afford to spend more time building levels.

Solid, worth more than $3, and the only downside is the tiny course selection.

There are 3 things that 3D Ultra did better, though:
- Your power meter is too precise. Take out the notches, because they make the courses too solvable.
- Click-through ball-settling, please!
- Deserves more content, and it'd be worth paying more money to get it.
